project.teaser: The OCEAN project approach is to contribute to the mitigation of navigational accidents by supporting the navigators to do an even better job than they do presently. Such support does not only relate to an ‘on-the-spot’ enhancement of navigational awareness – including...
project.objective: The OCEAN project approach is to contribute to the mitigation of navigational accidents by supporting the navigators to do an even better job than they do presently. Such support does not only relate to an ‘on-the-spot’ enhancement of navigational awareness – including the presence of marine mammals and floating containers – or an improved performance of evasive manoeuvring and other mitigating actions. The project will go both deeper and wider, to identify and suggest amendments or improvements in the most pertinent factors that may contribute to events becoming accidents: training, technical, human or organisational factors, operational constraints, processes and procedures, commercial pressures or structural issues like shortcomings in rules and regulations. From an implementation perspective, the OCEAN project will develop new design methods and operational processes, as well as integrating existing technologies to provide novel and improved functionalities. A key convergence point is the overall navigation situation assessment made by the operator, and the project aims at providing an integrated and designed-for-the-purpose presentation of near-field threats and navigational hinderances. The project outputs will include an Evasive Manoeuvring Agent, intended to work in tandem with existing ship systems, continuously assessing navigational safety with respect to grounding or collision with other ships, fixed structures or other threats, and the visualization of advanced manoeuvring prediction. OCEAN will suggest the creation of a European Navigational Hazard infrastructure to collect, process and distribute data relating to the presence of marine mammals and floating containers. Further innovations comprise input to upcoming and revised international standards for maritime communications and practical methods to design maritime instruments and devices, all of which will be demonstrated in consolidated scenarios.
project.title: Operator-Centered Enhancement of Awareness in Navigation
project.keywords: maritime safety, human centred design, situation awareness, navigational accidents

article.title: Better support for navigators to improve safety

result.title: Workshop Report (including specialist recommendations)
result.description: D4.1 will report on the workshop organised under task 4.1. It will include the proceedings of the workshop, the programme and info on participants who have provided their consent to have their info published in the deliverable and specialist recommendations to align the work in OCEAN with other efforts to reduce incidents involving vessels and marine mammals.

result.title: Root cause analysis (RCA) on navigational accidents
result.description: As output of task 1.4, D1.4 will establish a cause-and-effect- diagram for navigational accidents and the prioritisation of direct and latent root causes.

result.title: Patterns relating to lost containers
result.description: Based on task 5.1, the deliverable will include a survey of available data and reports on lost containers and will provide an analysis of the patterns relating to reported lost containers.

result.title: Proper future communications relating to dynamic navigational warnings
result.description: D5.4 will report on the opportunities from existing and new communication technologies and systems for notification and dissemination of information related to loss of containers, analysed under task 5.4.

result.title: Tailored information packages for stakeholders
result.description: D10.4 will compile the different information packages tailored to different categories of stakeholders developed under task 10.2. It will document the first version of these info packages. Further updates will be included within 10.9 and 10.10.

result.title: EMA interface description and identification of marine standard needs
result.description: D8.2 will report on EMA interface development support in relation to existing ship systems and marine standards and suggestions for new interfaces and standards, based on the work under task 8.2.

result.title: Improved training standards
result.description: Based on task 2.2, D2.2 will identify weaknesses and opportunities in minimum training standards identified by the IMO and will provide digital training materials and videos for the maritime education and training community.

result.title: Gap analysis of methods and practice
result.description: Based on task 3.1, D3.1 will provide an analysis of the gap between the availability of methods for the involvement of end users applicable for the maritime domain and the mainstream practice.

result.title: Lost container forecast for ships, small craft and recovery operations
result.description: D5.3 will provide a novel navigational warning function using a predictive model of container losses, developed under task 5.3 and building on the work done in task 5.1.

result.title: First update of the DECP
result.description: It will consist of the first update 6 months after the project start of the dissemination, exploitation and communication plan from the proposal, done under task 10.1.

result.title: Second update of the DECP
result.description: It will consist of the second update of the dissemination, exploitation and communication plan, done under task 10.1, based on the analysis of the implementation of the first update.

result.title: Another ECDIS induced accident? Aer all these years, why can’t we get it right?

details.authors: T. Porathe, E. S. Petersen, M. Lützhoft

result.title: Overall infrastructure design
result.description: D6.1 will document the overall infrastructure design for the European Navigational Hazard Infrastructure, reporting on the work done in task 6.1.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - OCEAN (Operator-Centered Enhancement of Awareness in Navigation)
result.teaser: The OCEAN project is focused on enhancing operator awareness in navigation, to reduce the frequency of severe accidents like collision and grounding, to mitigate ship-strike risks to marine mammals, and to mitigate the risk presented by floating obstacles to ships.The project...
result.description: periodic

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Validation of selected data sets
result.description: D7.2 will document the work under task 7.3 concerning the verification and validation of datasets and information identified in task 7.1 and 7.2.

result.title: Initial training on dependable systems review
result.description: D3.5 will provide a briefing for the project partners relating to the dependable systems review, as per task 3.4

result.title: Identification of navigational accidents’ root causes
result.description: Based on task 1.1, D1.1 will identify the dominant causes identified for navigational accidents including latent or less recognized causes including HCD and system risks, through an in-depth reassessment of past accidents, input from senior navigators and available data. It will also discuss these against the project pre-proposal hypotheses.

result.title: Improved operator decision-making
result.description: As output of task 2.3, D2.3 will compile design guidelines for WP3 and training requirements for improved operator decision-making.

result.title: Identification of information conducive to enhanced tactical situation awareness
result.description: Building on the outputs of WP1 and as a result of the work done under task 7.1, D7.1 will provide an identification and ranking of actionable information conducive to enhanced tactical situation awareness.

result.title: Knowledge repository (TRL4-5)
result.description: As output of task 1.2, D1.2 will consist of a knowledge repository that will organise collected data on navigation accidents root causes and analysis.

result.title: Information needs relating to the recovery of lost containers
result.description: Based on the knowledge gathered from user workshops and surveys under task 5.2, D5.2 will identify requirements and information needs for notifying and facilitating container salvage and tracking for the relevant authorities.

result.title: Project website
result.description: It will consist of the public project website, developed under task 10.2.

result.title: Tracking navigational hazard databases design and implementation
result.description: D6.2 will document the design and implementation of both marine mammals and lost containers databases carried out under task 6.2 and will include the full analysis of the different data streams, data fields and underlying data models.

result.title: KPIs and metrics to measure and improve navigational safety
result.description: As output of task 1.3, D1.3 will document the most qualified and practically applicable KPIs on navigation accident categorisation and the process to define and select them.

result.title: BNWAS escalation architecture
result.description: D8.3 will be the demonstrator for the BNWAS escalation architecture developed under task 8.3.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
